short_summary: The Government of Canada intends to sell nonmetallic hose sets.
description: The Government of Canada is seeking bids for a nonmetallic hose set consisting of two lots: 12 units for CFB Esquimalt, and 12 units for CFB Halifax.
full_summary:
## Government Tender Announcement
### Title
Hose Set, Non-Metallic
### Description
The Department of National Defence is issuing a request for proposal (RFP) for the procurement of hose sets, non-metallic. The items required are:

* Item 1: Hose Set, Non-Metallic, Part No.: CB122M0192-0180, NCAGE: 01276, Quantity: 12, Unit of Issue: EA, to be delivered to CFB Esquimalt.
* Item 2: Hose Set, Non-Metallic, Part No.: CB122M0192-0180, NCAGE: 01276, Quantity: 12, Unit of Issue: EA, to be delivered to CFB Halifax.

### Procurement Process

* A Notice of Proposed Procurement has been issued.
* This is a competitive procurement process, open to all interested bidders.
* Bidders must submit their proposal in accordance with the RFP documents.
* The proposal must be submitted in Canadian dollars.

### Important Notes

* The Department of National Defence has designated this procurement as subject to a preference for Canadian Goods and Services (CFTA).
* Bidders must indicate if they are offering an equivalent or substitute product.
* The Crown retains the rights to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

### Contact Information

* Jean-Pierre Normandin
* Business Analyst
* Directorate Maritime Procurement
* (819) 939-3674
* jean-pierre.normandin@forces.gc.ca

### Tender Documents

* The tender notice and RFP documents are available at: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/6175/rfp-w8482-241649-a-en.pdf (English) and https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/6175/rfp-w8482-241649-a-fr_0.pdf (French)

### Tender Closing Date

* The tender closing date is July 17, 2023, at 14:00 (EDT).

Note: I followed the original format as much as possible while rephrasing the text in a more professional manner. I also kept the translation in both official languages of Canada (English and French) as per the original text.   Let me know if you need any further changes.
